channel.title: How could I get
channel.description:
How could I get my coords where i stand? What command? In my server ::mypos doesn't work.
Do I have to use a different client? Server?
Help please.

item.title: How could I get
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

lol thank you for acusing me but i wont steal i have my own server to worry about, btw:idc wat u do im just offering

item.title: How could I get
item.dc:creator: @kiamyhelp kiamyhelp
item.description:
@kiamyhelp wrote:

[quote=“slomifier, post:7, topic:227622”]ok 1, lester might be trying to steal any work that you’ve done

  1. Put the command “mypos” under or in your other commands. Just search for if (command.startsWith( and put the “mypos” in with the rest.[/quote]

yea never give anyone u dont know your work. just put the command after the ending bracket of another command

Read full topic

item.title: How could I get
item.dc:creator: @Hey3 Hey*
item.description:
@Hey3 wrote:

[quote=“slomifier, post:2, topic:227622”]What source are you using?

if (command.startsWith("mypos")) { sendMessage("You are standing on X="+absX+" Y="+absY); }

Might not be in your server yet.[/quote]Where should i put it?

I tried it in client.java but it didnt work.

Do i need to add it to client or server files?

Read full topic

item.title: How could I get
item.dc:creator: @krandolv krandolv
item.description:
@krandolv wrote:

Use ::coordson and look in the bottom-right hand corner of the screen that is your current position and it will update as u move =) yw

Read full topic

item.title: How could I get
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Underneath where it says your energy, it should say your coordinates.
